intro: Jobinia glossostemma, commonly known as the golden root, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its erect stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its roots are often harvested for their medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats.
